fields.description:
After insert a new TOC Zone macro, the list style parameter "none" is ignored.

Steps to reproduce : 
* Insert TOC zone macro to a page
* Select "Output type" list and "List style" as None.
* Check the preview - You will notice headings displayed in bullet points.
This is not expected behavior as you selected List style as None.

According to the documentation https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Table+of+Content+Zone+Macro
bq. none — no list style is displayed

This is confusing for the users.
fields.summary: List style parameter "none" is ignored in TOC Zone macro
Unable to create a Confluence Space when a default space logo is configured - Page not found after the Create Space button is clicked

fields.description:
Default Confluence setup is not able to restore database connections, requiring manual setup by the sys admin. 

This should be part of the product and not an administrative task. Also this will lower the number of support issues reported by customers.
fields.summary: Default Confluence setup does not restore database connections

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Have a Confluence instance linked with a JIRA instance
# Place a custom icon at {{<JIRA-INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/icons/}}
# Navigate to *JIRA Administration > g g > Issue Types*
# Click Edit, specify the new icon
# Go to Confluence, in the editor: *Insert > JIRA Issue*
# Notice that the icon is already not displayed and is used as a background of the {{<span>}} instead

Tested with Confluence 5.1.4 hooked up with JIRA 5.2.11. (Sample file attached to this ticket)
fields.summary: JIRA Issues macro renders incorrectly when custom icons are used for issue types
Group management in spaces

fields.summary: People page - Users is shown several times
Inform user that their account has been deactivated at login screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29859].
  {panel}

It creates the page in the root of the space, regardless of what page you are on when you click the button. In previous versions, if you put a Create from Template macro on a page, and clicked it from that page, it would create a child page from the macro. This no longer works in 5.1.4.


*Temporary workarounds:*

*WA 1*. After clicking the 'Create from Template' button, manually change the location.
* For custom templates, like any new page, the location can be changed by clicking the Location button at the bottom of the page.

*WA 2*. Manually create a link to replace the button.
Only for custom templates _(hoover over the button and you should see 'templateId' variable in numbers)_
* Copy Link provided by the 'Create Template Button'.
!Workaround_step1.jpeg|thumbnail!
* Edit page where the button is at.
* Create a new Web Link
* paste the link and add {{&fromPageId=PAGEID}} (where PAGEID is the 'pageId' number shown shown in your browser address bar) !Workaround_step2.jpeg|thumbnail!
* insert, save and test

h2. Solution
The recommended solution is to upgrade to Confluence 5.2.3 when that is released. If for some reason that is not possible, you can manually install a fixed version of the plugin via the add-on administration page:
* For those of you that are unable to upgrade from 5.1.4, [download this version|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/97522/97522_confluence-create-content-plugin-1.5.25.1.obr].
* For those of you currently running Confluence 5.2.1, [download this version|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/98979/98979_confluence-create-content-plugin-1.5.36.obr].
fields.summary: 'Create from Template' Macro No Longer Creates Child Pages

fields.description: http://localhost/setup/setupstandarddb-start.action?database=mssql points to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/How+to+install+jTDS+JDBC+drivers but the target doesn't exist.
fields.summary: Website link doesn't work
User list macro should not have the 'online/offline' options in OnDemand
Convert collapsed space shortcuts and child navigation buttons to ADG subtle buttons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29854].
  {panel}

A Confluence admin can configure the maximum attachment size in the general configuration screen in the admin console.

Right now, this is in bytes:

!http://cl.ly/image/3w3H34172A3P/Image%202013.07.05%2012%3A54%3A53%20PM.png!

This actually makes it really hard as the average user just wants to do this in Megabytes, not bytes. So you have to do a calculation to work out how many megabytes.

We should simply change to to be Megabytes. Even the error messages we display when someone goes over the limit is in megabytes, not bytes.
fields.summary: Make attachment storage configuration easier to setup by switching it to megabytes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29853].
  {panel}

I set up JIRA
I set up Confluence
When I go to the merge it synchronized properly
I get the following display:


Full synchronisation completed successfully.
Local administrator account created.
We have created a local administrator with the same username and password as the JIRA system administrator you provided. This will ensure that you can always log into Confluence to update the system configuration.

After this the next button does not work so I can not finish the installation.
fields.summary: Setup does not continue past JIRA merge

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29852].
  {panel}

When adding a link to an emoticon, the notion of the link disappears in the editor.
The link works, but cannot be changed anymore like regular links.

To replicate the issue:
 a) Click Insert > Emoticon > Checkmark
 b) highlight the emoticon, click Insert > Link > target
 c) This results in the emoticon on the page with the link to the target.

The editor does not show the "Goto link / edit / unlink" dialog on the emoticon, even though the link is there.
fields.summary: Unable to edit link on emoticon

fields.description:
According to [javadoc|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/labels/LabelManager.html#getCurrentContentForLabel(com.atlassian.confluence.labels.Label)] Labelmanager.getCurrentContentForLabel does not return deleted pages.

However, deleted pages are returned.

* Install the following plugin https://github.com/ukuhnhardt/labelmanagerbug.git
* Create a few pages with the same label
* Add a page with the {{\{page-report:label=Label\}}}
* delete one of the prev pages
* refresh the page report page

Hint: rebuilding the index does not solve the problem :D
fields.summary: LabelManager.getCurrentContentForLabel reports deleted pages
"toggle sidebar"-button on top right does not work (properly)in IE9 when using Documentation Theme in Confluence 5.1.2
Sidebar collapse/expand does not work with [
The link behind the title of the page should be a tiny link.
The "Link to this Page" dialog should offer a wiki formatted link.
Documentation request - PDF export does not handle page layouts

fields.description:
When using IE, if a section of a page layout is not fully visible in the edit screen, then attempting to add a mention will result in the following behaviour:
# The view will jump upwards 
# A gray background will appear very briefly behind the '@' character, and then disappear. 

*Steps to Reproduce:*
Note: Please refer [to the following video|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/95779/mentions.mkv] for an example.
# Create a page, and add any layout.
# Create a section large enough that it is larger than your editing window.
# Attempt to insert a mention (either via the insert menu, or by the '@' shortcut)

*Workaround:*
After the mention fails to work and the page has repositioned, any following mention will work until you scroll.
fields.summary: Mentions do not work in IE when using page layouts if the column is not fully visible on the screen

fields.description:
RuntimeException occurred while transforming editor format to storage format (java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "confluence-link") (500)

This is reproducible through the following simple sequence of steps:
# Create a new page
# Create an h1. Heading
# Enter 'Anchor link', select that phrase and press ctrl-K
# On the advanced tab, enter #Heading
# Save the page
# Edit the page again
# Change the text of the heading
# Try to preview, save or 'Open source editor'. All of these fail.

I'm marking this as critical as it blocks saving your changes, so you loose work.
fields.summary: RuntimeException occurred while transforming editor format to storage format

fields.description: In the confluence link popup the body text "Here you can insert a link into the page using Wiki Markup" contains a broken link ("wiki markup") which points to a deleted page on CAC.
fields.summary: The wiki markup link in the confluence link pop up points to a deleted page

fields.description:
If you insert the wrong mention and then undo, it undoes up to the previous undo point. It's really annoying.

E.g. if I 
* type "I'm filing a bug about mentions that I hope we can fix really soon. Maybe @"
* then type "Don"
* then select myself so it enters [~don.willis@atlassian.com]
* then decide that's ridiculous and press undo.
All the text will be deleted.

Ideally undo would only undo the mention.  I suspect it should leave the @Don behind.
fields.summary: Undo after a mention undoes the whole line

If i paste a table with multiple lines via wiki syntax into the confluence editor, no table will be created for the whole pasted text. If i place cursor at the end of the last line of the pasted code, only that line will be created.

\||header1||header2||
\|1|2|
\|3|4|
\|4|5|
\|6|7|

fields.description:
+Repro steps:+
# Create a page with a link to an anchor to another page in the same space.
# Copy the page created in step #1. Specify a location in a different space.
# Check anchor link (no longer works).

The problem is that no space information is included in the anchor link to an anchor in a page in the same space. When the home space of the page changes, the link no longer points to the right destination page. This happens even when you specify the space key in the link.

If instead of copying and changing the location you move the page to another space, the anchor works as expected.
fields.summary: Anchor links broken after copying page to another space

fields.description:
1. Use Snipping Tool and capture an image
2. Ctrl-C
3. Try to paste image (Ctrl-V) into a confluence page in edit mode
4. Image seems to be copied án dis displayed in page but after saving instead of the image a "Broken Image" placeholder is shown. No attachment has been created.

Error only occurs with Firefox 22.0.
Works with Chrome 28.0.
Pasting images in IE 10 does not work at all.
fields.summary: Copy and Paste of image not working with Firefox 22.0

fields.description:
We are using the Page Properties macro as a kind of event history. Because of that we store the values in the first value *row* instead of the first value *column*. Every time a event occures we add a new value row at the top. The Page Properties Report the values as expected.

But, when looking at the page containing the Page Properties macro still the first *column* is styled as header even if actually the first *row* should be styled as header. In editing mode all stylings are correct.
fields.summary: Page Properties renders first column with column header style even if its not
Allow editor to be customized by configuring custom formats
Allow side-bar to be hidden

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29827].
  {panel}

A Confluence space with anonymous permissions enabled does not automatically display content when using the quick-search bar.

*Current Behaviour:*
Anonymously accessible results are returned when a user presses 'return' on their search query.

*Expected Behaviour:* 
Results are returned dynamically while user is typing (as an anonymous user).

Included screenshots reproducing the issue and demonstrating the expected results.
fields.summary: Auto-complete from quicksearch does not dynamically display space results for anonymous users
GeneralUtil.escapeForHtmlAttribute does not completely escape the given input for use in an html attribute context
Alias does not work with external links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29822].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to replicate (Global look and feel)
# Click *Space Tools > Overview*.
# The error below is displayed.

h4. Steps to replicate (Documentation Theme)
# Click *Browse > Space Operations*.
# The error below is displayed.

h4. Error
{noformat}
System Error
Cause
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getSpaceAdmins' in class com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.actions.ViewSpaceSummaryAction threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at spaces/viewspacedetails.vm[line 36, column 53]
    at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:223)
caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.DefaultSpaceManager$UserComparator.compare(DefaultSpaceManager.java:688)
{noformat}

h4. Workaround
The error is caused by a group or individual user not being found in the space permissions page, possibly after having imported the space into the instance, or deleted a group/user. To workaround that, go to the space's permissions page and remove any 'not found' group or user.
* https://<your_domain>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/spacepermissions.action?key=<space_key>
fields.summary: Space Operations/Overview link throws error when Space Admins are not found

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29821].
  {panel}

Page overwrite warning message is not appearing when changes made over different network.

Steps to reproduce:
# Have 2 users editing a page from 2 different network
# Both users do something in the edit mode
# 1 of the user save the change made
# The other user save later and no warning message will appear

Expected behavior would appear as the second user will overwrite the first user who made a change.

This doesn't occur within the same network.
fields.summary: Page overwrite warning message is not appearing when changes made over different network

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Create a page with Code blocks, and try to add [this|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/95526/default.jsp] piece of code.
# You'll see a behavior like this:
!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/95525/Screen%20Shot%202013-07-02%20at%2012.38.45%20PM.png!

(!) For this example I've used a code that has 2067 lines as you can see here:
!Screen Shot 2013-07-02 at 12.38.35 PM.png! 
Since CodeBlock doesn't honor the number of line, due to Word Wrap, it give us more lines.

h3. Workaround
There is none yet
fields.summary: CodeBlock Does not Honor the Number of Lines due to Word Wrap

fields.description:
Reproduced with Chrome 28.0.1500.52

+Repro steps:+
# Create a blank Confluence page
# In the editor, add a new task list. The checkbox with the text _"Type task here and @mention a user to assign them the task"_ appears.
# Finish the task list and some text.
# In the paragraph after the text, before you enter any text, click on the _task list_ button (or use the shortcut '\[' + '\]')
(x) The cursor jumps to the previous line and no task list is added
fields.summary: Multiple task list in a page causes inconsistent behaviour in Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29818].
  {panel}

Would it be possible to extend the same functionality used by [pagetitle] links to {include:pagetitle} macros?  Can {include:pagetitle} macros be treated like [pagetitle] links?

Links such as [pagetitle] automatically change when the page title changes (is renamed).  For example, lets say that I have a page named "Grape" and a link to [Grape] on the "Food" page and then I rename page "Grape" to "Raisin" then the link on the "Food" page would automatically become [Raisin].  In other words links are renamed or follow when the page they reference is renamed.

When I check the "History" tab I on the "Food" page I see "Grape" as an "Outgoing Link".  When I check the "History" tab on the "Grape" page I see "Food" as an "Incomming Link".

The problem is that when I have an {include:Grape} macro and then rename page "Grape" to "Raisin" my {include:Grape} does not change to {include:Raisin} and essentially becomes a broken reference.

{include:pagetitle} macros do not appear in the "Outgoing Links" section or the "Incomming Links" section.  I wish that they would.
fields.summary: Handle {include:pagetitle} macro references like [pagetitle] link references

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Attach [this|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/95516/spreadsheet%20test.xlsx] example Excel file in a page of Confluence.
# Save the macro and visualize the page, you should see a 'broken' image, which should be the chart:
!Screen Shot 2013-07-02 at 10.25.20 AM.png!

h3. Is working on Confluence 4.3.7

As you can see, it the same file:
!Screen Shot 2013-07-02 at 10.27.01 AM.png!
fields.summary: Chart of an Excel Chart File is Broken.
Sort table row in Edit Mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29815].
  {panel}

Considering a setup:

browser -- reverse proxy -- confluence server

Whereas the confluence server has an internal hostname, say confluence.internal.example.com and the reverse proxy presents a different one to the browser, say confluence.external.example.com.  The reverse proxy will translate the internal/external hostnames in HTTP Headers and Payload.

Steps to reproduce
Set BASE URL to the external hostname, edit wiki page, insert link, save wikipage.  The links inside the wikipage will be broken (xhtml shows <ac:link/>).

Workaround:
use internal hostname ;)  But since i dont know which tasks inside confluence need the BASE URL i cant tell wether this is actually making sense.  https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF51/Configuring+the+Server+Base+URL is a bit unclear about how that would help in the particular case, or what the individual mentioned features would actually achieve.

I believe that when saving the wiki page confluence checks wether the url is actually valid (regex match against BASE URL?) and invalidates the link if it is not.

Fix
i would propose to, additionally to set a BASE URL, allow for Server-Alias Names which are considered to be the "same-Confluence" Instance and thus links to the server alias names are either accepted plain or internally rewritten to the BASE URL when saving Wiki pages
fields.summary: confluence BASE URL may break proxy

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create or edit a  page
# Write two lines of text in it
# Position cursor on your first line
# Select the first line using "Shift" + "End"
# Try to delete, cut or start typing text to replace
# Editor will deleted the whole line instead of just the characters selected

h3. Expected Results:

This issue is not reproducible using Chrome and Confluence successfully write only the characters inputted by the user after selecting the character using "Shift" + "End".

h3. Actual Results:

Editor deleted the whole line and the second line will moved up.

h3. Environment Information (In the Environment Field):

Internet Explorer 9 and 10
fields.summary: Shift + End Selection on IE Selected The Whole Line Instead of Only The Characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29812].
  {panel}

Currently, if there is a substantial amount of blog posts, then the blog post listing that is on the right side of the page would extend to suit the amount of blog posts that are available. 

This can cause inconveniences if a user would just like to comment or 'like' the blog post that he/she is reading, as they would have to scroll all the way down to the bottom of the list of blogs :

!Confluence blog.png|thumbnail!

It would be better if there was a scrollbar of some sort for the blog listings, so that this situation can be avoided
fields.summary: Optimize the blog post listing to avoid wasting page space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29811].
  {panel}

By default, Confluence Top Menu was not pinned therefore it will be hidden when you scroll down the page in the browser.

As you can see before I scroll down
!before.png!

And After I scroll down.
!after.png!

It would convenient for user if there is an setting in Confluence Admin to let user pin the Global menu so it won't be hidden when user scroll down the Confluence Page.
fields.summary: Pin The Confluence Global Menu so it won't  be hidden when scroll down.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29808].
  {panel}

Using advanced linking to link to an anchor on another page in the same space. This is an automatically generated anchor by using Heading formats and creating a table of contents. I haven't tried doing the same thing by manually creating the anchor. What I've experienced is that sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't. When it doesn't work it's because the link reference generated is incorrect. For example I will type in the link reference 

Email Notifications#Session Cancelled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29805].
  {panel}

The database configuration needs to be updated in step 3 of page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+MySQL#DatabaseSetupForMySQL-Step3.ConfigureMySQLServer

In the comments, the tx_isolation level is much discussed but this is not mentioned in the setup steps. Request to add:

fields.description:
When I use the TOC macro within a Live template, I get the following error message:  

Error rendering macro 'toc': [com.ctc.wstx.exc. WstxLazyException] com.ctc.wstx.exc. WstxParingException: Undeclared namespace prefix "at" at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,471]
fields.summary: TOC Macro Not Working with Live Template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29799].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a page
# Capture a screenshot or a smaller image to clipboard
# Paste it into the editor

*Expected behavior*
As like in Chrome it should add the image as attachment and display when saving the page.

*Actual behavior*
Image is show in the editor, but once saving the page it will display as 'Broken image'

Reproduced on Ubuntu with Firefox 22.x as well as in a Windows 7 VirtualBox too. With Firefox 19.x it worked fine.

*Workaround*
- Save the copied image to a file first using any image editor and attach the image from a file instead from the clipboard.
- Downgrade to Firefox 21: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/install-older-version-of-firefox
fields.summary: Paste images into the editor from clipboard using Firefox 22.x and above does not work

fields.description:
After removing a table row  with a cursor directly on top of the empty cell, the cell will become disrupted when you type on it.

h3. Step to reproduce.
# Create a new page in IE9
# Create a table
# Click a cell directly above an empty cell
# Remove the row 
# Type in the empty cell

Refer to this [video|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/95424/rowdelete.avi.zip] for detailed instruction
fields.summary: (IE9)Bug when remove a table row above an empty cell in Editor

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:

If you have an attachment macro on a page to display attachments for that page, the drag and drop function works fine. 
However, If you're using an attachment macro to displays attachments from a different page, the drag and drop does not work -- users have to go to the original page, drag and drop, and return.
fields.summary: Drag and drop Attachments macro in a different page uploads to current page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29796].
  {panel}

See [Atlassian Answers Content By Label discussion|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/125087/content-by-label-required-labels-and-the-and-or-operator].

OR logic between labels makes sense as long as you don't have any required labels, i.e. it will return pages that have at least one of the labels specified.  However, once you add a required label (+label), the other non-required labels become optional and the results include pages with just the required label.  The required label should be applied *in addition* to the other labels listed in the configuration.

Operator: OR (default)

*Configuration*: aa,bb
*Results*: Returns pages labeled with aa, bb, aa/bb

*Configuration*: aa,bb,+cc
*Results*: Returns pages labeled with aa/cc, bb/cc, aa/bb/cc, and cc (<-- this, pages with just cc, is the problem)
fields.summary: Content by label logic is flawed when using a required label
Attachment macro in a comment disables comment box

fields.description:
When adding mentions in Confluence page, the mention sign will be visible in the page view. Please see the following screenshot which illustrates the behavior:
!scshot1.png!

However, the behavior is not reproducible in the Page Preview mode:
!scshot2.png!

This behavior is reproducible on Confluence 5.1.3, and using Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox web browser. 

In one customer case, it seems that the behavior can be critical, as per illustrated in the following screenshot:
!scshot3.png!
fields.summary: The mentions sign (@) is visible in front of the username in Confluence page preview

fields.description:
We've got an issue with "edit in office". We cannot use this functionality anymore. The documents are always opened with "read only".

We found a lot of posts to this topic, but no real solution for us.

It worked like a charm some weeks ago, but suddenly got broken.

This seems to be an problem with Office 2007, not with 2010 and 2013 (but we cannot upgrade that easily for the moment).

Another issue that seems to go in the same direction:
We cannot connect to WebDAV anymore (via Transmit) https://ourURL.ch/plugins/servlet/confluence/default). There is a «403 forbidden» showing up.

Can you support us with this, please?

Unfortunately I cannot send the generated files via the support request in the admin panel > I always get an «Internal Server Error». But I could give it to you as an attachment.

Thank you very much.
fields.summary: Edit in Office functionality - WebDAV

fields.description:
Confluence pages can contain attachment images, and these images could have image effects applied to it (e.g., taped corners, shadows etc). 

These effects are not applied to the image when exporting as Word documents.
fields.summary: word document export does not properly render images with image effects applied to them

fields.description:
PPT documents created by OpenOffice and LibreOffice fail to render when used with the viewfile macro. Files have been saved in Word 97 format. DOC and XLS files work without problems.

See attached files for replication.
fields.summary: PPT documents created by OpenOffice and LibreOffice fail to render with viewfile macro.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Allow anonymous to be able to access Confluence trough [Global Permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Global+Permissions+Overview] configuration
# Ensure that anonymous user [only have view permission to a space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Assigning+Space+Permissions] that use default theme
!anonymous.png|thumbnail!
# Access Confluence anonymously
# Access the space
# "Space Tools" option is available for anonymous user
!spacetools.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results:

As describe by the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Administering+a+Space], this option should only be available by space administrators:
{quote}
The 'Space tools' option  appears only if you are a space administrator for the space or you are a super user (a member of the {{confluence-administrators}} group).{quote}

h3. Actual Results:

Space tools option available for anonymous user although *no configuration are configurable*.
fields.summary: Space Tools Options Available for Anonymous User

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29786].
  {panel}

*Request Background*

The new feature names [file list|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/File+List+Blueprint] act as a different type of page.

Hence as default, when created Confluence will automatically create a parent page named "File List" and list all File List pages under it. User may want File List to be created as a child page as they like the hierarchical order of Confluence content.

In order to achieve this, they could move file list pages accordingly. However they need to do it every time they created a new file list page.

*Possible Implementation*

Provide Confluence administrators the option to allow users to create File List as child page automatically.
fields.summary: Allow File List to be Created as Child Page
Option to Turn ON/OFF Text Wrapping in the Code Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29783].
  {panel}

in CF4.x there was a feature to choose a page (including a page browser) to detect the page where to move the attachment to (see screenshot 1). This feature is missing in CF5.x. (see screenhot 2) Hence its hardly possible to move an attachment to a specific page.

Is there a reason why this handy feature was removed?
Is there ny chance to get the choose page feature back?

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Move Attachment: choose page feature got lost in CF5.x
Better repeating events

fields.description:
1. Create a new page
2. Type some text
3. Click "Save"
Defect: Browser alert message "Do you really want to close this page?"
fields.summary: There is warning message in Save button
Word Document Export should allow page margins to be specified

fields.description:
h1. Steps to reproduce
# create a template
# insert instructional text on the template (make the instructional text relativley unique)
# insert more text below it (make sure the text doesn't include any words from the instructional text)
# save the template
# create a page from the template
# enter a title (make sure the title doesn't include any words from the instructional text) and save the page (without replacing the instructional text, just leave it alone)

Search for the string in the instructional text. The page will get returned in the search (which is not correct behaviour)

When the user gets to the page, they may be confused because the view page will not display the instructional text (which is correct behaviour)
fields.summary: instructional text shows up in search results

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

Attempting to remove a page version which does not exist results in a misleading error, either giving a NullPointerException if the version is 1 more than the highest version available (displayed as "CURRENT" in the web interface), or otherwise "java.lang.Exception: com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.NotPermittedException: You do not have the permissions to perform this action".

h4. Steps to Reproduce

I reproduced this using the Python CLI as seen below:

{code:none}
>>> import xmlrpclib
>>> server = xmlrpclib.ServerProxy("http://BASEURL/rpc/xmlrpc")
>>> token = server.confluence2.login("username", "password")
>>> server.confluence2.getPageHistory(token, "2031636")
[{'id': '2031637', 'modifier': 'admin', 'version': '1', 'modified': <DateTime '20130625T14:29:18' at 100cfd5a8>}]
>>> server.confluence2.removePageVersionByVersion(token, '2031636', 2)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/xmlrpclib.py", line 1224, in __call__
    return self.__send(self.__name, args)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/xmlrpclib.py", line 1578, in __request
    verbose=self.__verbose
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/xmlrpclib.py", line 1264, in request
    return self.single_request(host, handler, request_body, verbose)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/xmlrpclib.py", line 1297, in single_request
    return self.parse_response(response)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/xmlrpclib.py", line 1473, in parse_response
    return u.close()
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/xmlrpclib.py", line 793, in close
    raise Fault(**self._stack[0])
xmlrpclib.Fault: <Fault 0: 'java.lang.Exception: java.lang.NullPointerException'>
>>> server.confluence2.removePageVersionByVersion(token, '2031636', 3)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/xmlrpclib.py", line 1224, in __call__
    return self.__send(self.__name, args)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/xmlrpclib.py", line 1578, in __request
    verbose=self.__verbose
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/xmlrpclib.py", line 1264, in request
    return self.single_request(host, handler, request_body, verbose)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/xmlrpclib.py", line 1297, in single_request
    return self.parse_response(response)
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/xmlrpclib.py", line 1473, in parse_response
    return u.close()
  File "/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/xmlrpclib.py", line 793, in close
    raise Fault(**self._stack[0])
xmlrpclib.Fault: <Fault 0: 'java.lang.Exception: com.atlassian.confluence.rpc.NotPermittedException: You do not have the permissions to perform this action'>
{code}

h4. Workaround

Do not attempt to remove any non-existent version.
fields.summary: Attempting to remove non-existent page versions with the Remote API results in misleading error "You do not have the permissions to perform this action"
Blog tree in sidebar is misaligned

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

Create word docx
# Add multiple pics to it, 3 works. (or use attached document)
# Attach document to a confluence page
# Use viewdoc macro to render document to page.
# Save page and view that not all images appear.
# Refresh page to find a different set/subset of images render while another image does not render.

Env. conf 5.1.4/java 7/mysql

h5. Workaround:
Downgrade Office Connector plugin to v2.1.10 instead. This plugin version is compatible with Confluence  4.1.2 - 5.1.4 as per [this page|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.officeconnector/versions].

You may remove Office Connector plugin from ConfluenceInstall\confluence\WEB-INF\atlassian-bundled-plugins and replace it with [Office Connector v2.1.10|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.officeconnector/versions] and restart Confluence afterwards.
fields.summary: Images do not render when using viewfile macro for imported/attached word doc

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29768].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Import a space from Confluence where user who originally created the space (and thus is an administrator of it) doesn't exist anymore.
# Try to delete the space.

You'll receive the following stack trace and the space is unable to be deleted:

{noformat}
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getSpaceAdmins' in  class com.atlassian.confluence.spaces.actions.ViewSpaceSummaryAction threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at spaces/viewspacedetails.vm[line 36, column 53]

      at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.velocity.ProfilingParseDirective.render(ProfilingParseDirective.java:24)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:175)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:336)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.Parse.render(Parse.java:263)
      at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.velocity.ProfilingParseDirective.render(ProfilingParseDirective.java:24)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:175)
      at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72)

      at com.atlassian.xwork.interceptors.XWorkTransactionInterceptor.intercept(XWorkTransactionInterceptor.java:56)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Go into Space Permissions for that space and remove any individual users who have administrator permissions that don't exist anymore. The space is then able to be deleted.
fields.summary: NullPointerException when trying to delete a space if space administrator user doesn't exist
Ability to indent macros (panels, code blocks, etc)
Allow add more sections on Page Layout
Confluence emails should use tiny links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29763].
  {panel}

Creating a template in Confluence with multiple (different) variables will cause only the first value to actually be passed onto the edit page.

*Steps to recreate*
# Create a new template
# Create a table with 3 variables
# Set the following three properties: First variable is simple, Second as Multi Line, Third as List
# Save the template
# Create a new page using your new template
# Enter values for each box (make sure you select an option other than the first one for the dropdown box)
# Click Next

*Result*
Edit mode shows the table with only the first values entered, Everything else will be empty (or default to the first option for the dropdown box)
*Expected Result*
All values passed properly.

Note that having for example three simple text boxes does work properly.

This does not occur in 5.1-OD-9, but does happen in 5.1-OD-13 and 5.1.4 BTF.
fields.summary: Template variable values are lost going into Edit Mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29761].
  {panel}

We would like the ability to set the default notify watchers setting on/off globally, to reduce the number of emails regarding multiple minor edits to pages site wide.
My site is currently undergoing some growing pains and inevitably page content will be edited multiple times before the creator is happy with their creation. This means that any watchers of that page would get multiple email notifications about these edits. (granted unchecking a box isn't rocket science, but it's all about key clicks...)
Would it be possible to implement this feature in the future?
Thanks
fields.summary: Have the ability to switch the notify watchers setting to off globally
Allow Admin to make a custom page template the default for creating pages
Show only Confluence_user members in People Directory

fields.description:
Since CONF-13798, we store the build number in the database and prevent Confluence from starting up when the home directory and database build numbers don't match.

When a site restore is performed, the build number in the database is replaced with the value from the backup. When the backup is from a different version, this will prevent the next application startup with the error message:

{code}
Confluence will not start up because the build number in the home directory [...] doesn't match the build number in the database [...].
{code}

h4. Fix
Starting from version 5.1.5, the history of Confluence upgrades will no longer be included in a site backup. This means that backups created from 5.1.5 or later should no longer encounter this issue.

Restoring a backup that was created prior to 5.1.5 into any version of Confluence that is newer than 5.1.2 will still trigger this error, and the following workaround should be followed.

h4. Workaround

{panel:bgColor=#E08566}Important - Do NOT perform this workaround if the above error was encountered during an upgrade of Confluence (see the description of CONF-13798 for an explanation). If you are seeing this error during or shortly after an upgrade of Confluence, follow the instructions in [this document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Confluence+will+not+start+up+because+the+build+number+in+the+home+directory+doesn%27t+match+the+build+number+in+the+database%2C+after+upgrade] to resolve it.{panel}

h4. If you are restoring an XML backup

Workaround is to clear the build number from the database - it will be repopulated from the home directory at startup:

1. Shutdown Confluence 
2. *Backup your Confluence database!*
3. Run the following SQL query on the database:
{code}DELETE FROM confversion;{code}
fields.summary: Home directory and database build number mismatch in Confluence 5.1.x after a site restore (NOT after an upgrade)

fields.description:
This issue only happens in Internet Explorer 8, 9 and 11 (at least), and it can be reproduced in Confluence 5.x. 

h4.Steps to Reproduce:
This issue happens in two scenarios as you can see below.

_Scenario One:_
# Edit a page in Confluence.
# Please write a few lines of text, or it is fine if the page already has some contents.
# Try to click on the gray area below the bold button, or any other gray spot as you can see in the screenshot attached. One click will do the trick.
# Click on the *Bold* button, as in you wish to type with bold format.

_Scenario Two:_
# Edit a page in Confluence.
# Please write a few lines of text, or it is fine if the page already has some contents.
# Try to press *Italic* button, then press *Bold* button, and at last press *Italic* button again. or this can be in *Bold > Italic > Bold* order as well.

h4.Expected Results:
The cursor must remain on the last place it was. And there should be no change in the location of cursor in the text.

h4.Actual Results:
When trying Scenario one and two, the cursor jumps to the beginning of the first line.
fields.summary: Formatting applied to the text does not keep the cursor on the same location in IE
Add the ability to filter by 'template' on content macros

fields.description:
Hello,
yesterday I posted this issue on [Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/184067/text-encoding-for-output-from-getchildren-json-rpc-api-in-confluence], but I feel it really might be a bug, so I'm reporting it also here.

It's a problem with Confluence JSON-RPC API, "getChildren" method.
In the API output, Confluence pages titles containing "special characters" are not encoded correctly. See example:

{code}
[
    {
        "version": 1,
        "parentId": 28148060,
        "permissions": 0,
        "id": 28835879,
        "space": "TEST",
        "title": "Copy of Will s��",
        "url": "https://confluence:8443/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=28835879"
    },
    {
        "version": 1,
        "parentId": 28148060,
        "permissions": 0,
        "id": 29753574,
        "space": "TEST",
        "title": "Special chars-�??�?�?b��",
        "url": "https://confluence:8443/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=29753574"
    },
    {
        "version": 3,
        "parentId": 28148060,
        "permissions": 0,
        "id": 28835875,
        "space": "TEST",
        "title": "Will s��",
        "url": "https://confluence:8443/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=28835875"
    }
]
{code}

No matter what HTTP header I setup, it doesn't correct the output.
fields.summary: Problem with text encoding for output from getChildren JSON-RPC API in Confluence

fields.description:
http://screencast.com/t/bdPJZZq5jYe9

I ran into this issue in Chrome:
1. Add a table and type some content in a cell
2. Select all contents of the cell by double-clicking
3. Open the link browser and make the selected content a link
4. Doing so will put the content in the next table cell instead of the one I expect
fields.summary: Overzealous replacement of content for a table cell in the editor
